intro: Phebalium longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and evergreen foliage. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, cylindrical spikes and are usually pink or red in color. Phebalium longifolium is adapted to dry environments and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
